rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C199510

self.title: CDISC Clinical Classification Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading of Angina Pectoris TCCSGA101 Original Response Terminology

definition: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading Scale of Angina Pectoris original result for CCSGA101 test and test code.
name: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading Scale of Angina Pectoris Clinical Classification ORRES for CCSGAS101 TN/TC
preferredTerm: CDISC Clinical Classification Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading of Angina Pectoris TCCSGA101 Original Response Terminology
synonyms: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading Scale of Angina Pectoris Clinical Classification ORRES for CCSGAS101 TN/TC

terms.definition: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading Scale of Angina Pectoris original result for CCSGA101-Grade I: Ordinary physical activity does not cause angina, such as walking and climbing stairs. Angina with strenuous or rapid or prolonged exertion at work or recreation.
terms.preferredTerm: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading of Angina Pectoris CCSGA101 Original Result - Grade I

terms.definition: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading Scale of Angina Pectoris original result for CCSGA101-Grade II: Slight limitation of ordinary activity. Walking or climbing stairs rapidly, walking uphill, walking or stair climbing after meals, or in cold, or in wind, or under emotional stress, or only during the few hours after awakening. Walking more than two blocks on the level and climbing more than one flight of ordinary stairs at a normal pace and in normal conditions.
terms.preferredTerm: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading of Angina Pectoris CCSGA101 Original Result - Grade II

terms.definition: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading Scale of Angina Pectoris original result for CCSGA101-Grade III: Marked limitation of ordinary physical activity. Walking one or two blocks on the level and climbing one flight of stairs in normal conditions and at normal pace.
terms.preferredTerm: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading of Angina Pectoris CCSGA101 Original Result - Grade III

terms.definition: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading Scale of Angina Pectoris original result for CCSGA101-Grade IV: Inability to carry on any physical activity without discomfort, anginal syndrome may be present at rest.
terms.preferredTerm: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading of Angina Pectoris CCSGA101 Original Result - Grade IV
